content:
The main theorem in section 8.3.2 assumes that Y is a RegularSpace, and I was stuck for a while trying to figure out why it could not type synthesize to a T2Space, in order to use tendsto_nhds_unique about the uniqueness of limits.

Peeking at the solution, the assumption is changed so that Y is a T3Space. In Lean, is it the case that a RegularSpace is not Hausdorff by default? Should I submit a pull request to change the separation assumption in the main text?

I'm sorry about that. The definition of regular changed in mathlib recently and I thought I fixed the exercise but indeed the fix was only in the solution. Thanks for your report. It should be fixed now.
Ryan McCorvie has marked this topic as resolved.
